laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rising white-cell count from 12,000 at admission to 17,200 on the 2nd hospital day.

findings.Neutrophils: 75.3% at admission (normal range: 40–70), 76% on 2nd day, 85% on 3rd day.
findings.Lymphocytes: 17.4% at admission (normal range: 22–44), 17% on 2nd day, 10% on 3rd day.
findings.Monocytes: 6.5% at admission (normal range: 4–11), 5% on 2nd day, 5% on 3rd day.
findings.Eosinophils: 0.6% at admission (normal range: 0–8), 1% on 2nd day, 0% on 3rd day.
findings.Basophils: 0.2% at admission (normal range: 0–3), 1% on 2nd day, 0% on 3rd day.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Neutrophils increased, while lymphocytes decreased over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 141 mmol/liter at admission (normal range: 135–145), 138 on 2nd day, 143 on 3rd day.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Sodium levels increased from 141 to 143 mmol/liter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 3.4 mmol/liter at admission (normal range: 3.4–4.8), 3.2 on 2nd day, 3.5 on 3rd day.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Potassium levels decreased from 3.4 to 3.2 mmol/liter and then increased to 3.5.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 28 mmol/liter at admission (normal range: 23.0–31.9), 25.6 on 2nd day, 18.9 on 3rd day.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Carbon dioxide levels decreased from 28 to 18.9 mmol/liter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 121 mg/dl at admission (normal range: 70–110), 101 on 2nd day, 145 on 3rd day.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Glucose levels decreased from 121 mg/dl to 101 mg/dl and then increased to 145 mg/dl.

findings.White-cell count: 39 per mm3 (normal range: 0–5), 27 per mm3 from Tube 4 (normal range: 0–5).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Rabies virus antigen detected; rabies virus nucleic acids detected by PCR.
